lead_paragraph: John Stumpf, the bank’s leader, told lawmakers the sham accounts were an ethical lapse limited to the 5,300 low-level employees, who were fired.

headline.print_headline: Wells Fargo’s Reaction to Scandal Fails to Satisfy Angry Lawmakers
headline.main: Wells Fargo’s Reaction to Scandal Fails to Satisfy Angry Lawmakers

snippet: John Stumpf, the bank’s leader, told lawmakers the sham accounts were an ethical lapse limited to the 5,300 low-level employees, who were fired....
abstract: House Financial Services Committee interrogates John G Stumpf, Wells Fargo chief exec, about his role in bank's sales incentive program that led to creation of illegal and unauthorized bank and credit card accounts; Stumpf is also grilled over report from Office of Comptroller of the Currency revealing bank has been fined $20 million for violating lending rules for military members.
